video.title: Reading Rainbow
video.synopsis: New worlds of imagination unfold in this widely acclaimed series, which features guest celebrities reading selections from children's literature.

episodes.synopsis: LeVar uses bowling and domino artistry to demonstrate actions and consequences, then Beth Howland reads the classic, "If You Give a Mouse a Cookie."
episodes.title: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie

episodes.synopsis: Jordan Puryear reads "Two Old Potatoes and Me," about how old potatoes became a new crop, and LeVar and his daughter try recipes from the book.
episodes.title: Two Old Potatoes and Me

episodes.synopsis: LeVar reflects on his childhood, while Matthew Broderick reads "Owen," a story about a mouse who won't give up his beloved security blanket.
episodes.title: Owen

episodes.synopsis: Wayne Brady shares the story of Mr. George Baker, who decides that it's never too late to learn to read, even at nearly 100 years old.
episodes.title: Mr. George Baker

episodes.synopsis: LeVar looks at jobs people do late at night and early in the morning, a man visits nocturnal animals, and Martin Short reads about a dog and cat cafe.
episodes.title: Animal Café

episodes.synopsis: Gilda Radner reads Aesop's fable "The Tortoise and the Hare," while LeVar challenges himself in a bicycle race and visits a karate class.
episodes.title: The Tortoise and the Hare

episodes.synopsis: LeVar gets a "comedy makeover" before legendary comedian Phyllis Diller reads "Ludlow Laughs," about a man who never even smiled.
episodes.title: Ludlow Laughs

episodes.synopsis: LeVar explores how people around the world say thanks for kindness, and Nicholson Earl Billey reads a Native American poem of thanks to the Earth.
episodes.title: Giving Thanks: A Native American Good Morning Message

episodes.synopsis: LeVar is transformed into a movie monster, and Ruth Buzzi reads about a teacher who gets similarly made up to teach her class a lesson.
episodes.title: Miss Nelson Is Back

episodes.synopsis: LeVar gives his golden retriever, Roy, a spa day and a party for his birthday. Then, "Seinfeld"'s Jason Alexander reads stories about pets.
episodes.title: Pet Stories: You Don't Have to Walk

episodes.synopsis: LeVar talks to students in New York City about September 11, and Jeff Bridges reads about a man driven by sadness to create a metal forest.
episodes.title: The Tin Forest

episodes.synopsis: A friend shows LeVar yummy recipes, and Helen Mirren reads a book about a woman who'll let nothing stop her from baking an apple pie.
episodes.title: How to Make an Apple Pie and See the World

episodes.synopsis: LeVar meets the members of avant-garde percussion group Stomp, and Gregory Hines reads a story about musical instruments and how they come together.
episodes.title: Zin! Zin! Zin! A Violin

episodes.synopsis: In Tennessee, LeVar attends a barn dance and talks to the band and a fiddle maker. Then, country singer Roy Clark reads "Barn Dance!"
episodes.title: Barn Dance

episodes.synopsis: LeVar explores various sports, then reads selections from "Sports Pages," a book of poems about athletes pursuing their dreams of success.
episodes.title: Sports Pages

episodes.synopsis: LeVar enjoys music during an alligator encounter and a riverboat party. Fred Newman reads -- and provides music -- for the story of a young musician.
episodes.title: Mama Don't Allow

episodes.synopsis: LeVar learns how cowboys lived in the Old West and meets movie stunt riders, then Hoyt Acton reads the story of a rancher's day away from home.
episodes.title: Meanwhile Back at the Ranch

episodes.synopsis: After LeVar tries to make his own pizza, which is tougher than it looks, Josh Saviano of "The Wonder Years" reads a story about a pizzeria.
episodes.title: Little Nino's Pizzeria

episodes.synopsis: Building a birdhouse leads LeVar to explore how other animals live, then Eartha Kitt reads about a growing hermit crab's search for a new shell.
episodes.title: Is This a House for a Hermit Crab?

episodes.synopsis: LeVar meets an artist who creates shadow puppets, and Robert Guillaume reads "My Shadow," a poem by Robert Louis Stevenson.
episodes.title: My Shadow

episodes.synopsis: Vacation fun, brilliant sunsets, animals enjoying warm days and more appear in a book of summertime photographs presented by Ossie Davis.
episodes.title: Summer

episodes.synopsis: LeVar explores the messy business of clay animation, which is used in the telling of "The Piggy in the Middle," the featured story.
episodes.title: Piggy in the Puddle

episodes.synopsis: LeVar heads to New York and ventures to the roof of a skyscraper that's much like the ones in the featured book, "Tar Beach."
episodes.title: Tar Beach

episodes.synopsis: Angela Bassett reads about the man whose art revitalized Watts, California.
episodes.title: The Wonderful Tower of Watts

episodes.synopsis: LeVar learns about pigs by visiting a farm and interviewing Kermit the Frog about his girlfriend, Miss Piggy; James Coco reads "Perfect the Pig."
episodes.title: Perfect the Pig
